availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Hotel in Lexington, Kentucky. Founded as the Postlethwait Tavern by John Postlethwait and Samuel Postlethwait in Lexington, Kentucky, in 1797. Rebuilt as the Phoenix Hotel in 1820 after a fire burned the original building. Proprietors: Thomas Chiles and Clerk Chiles (1860), C.T. Worley (1864).

ab.bibl:
"Lexington Races," Daily Courier, (Louisville, KY), 5 June 1860, p. 1.
Williams' Lexington City Directory for 1864-1865, (Lexington: Williams & Company, 1864), p. 78.
George W. Ranck, History of Lexington Kentucky, its Early Annals and Recent Progress, (Cincinnati: Robert Clarke & Company, 1872), p. 115.
J. Winston Coleman, "Phoenix Hotel" in The Kentucky Encyclopedia, ed. John E. Kleber. (Lexington: University Press of Kentucky, 1992), 719-720.
Wynelle Deese, Lexington, Kentucky: Changes in the Early Twentieth Century, (Charleston: Arcadia Publishing, 1998), p. 79.
